mods.abstract: Female, rag doll, Raggedy Ann, cloth head and all body, jointed at shoulders and hips, outline stitched and painted face, dark brown yarn hair with ribbon decoration, pinafore underwear with white dotted swiss, blue floral cotton dress with lace trimming at neck. Accompanying information describes John B. Gruelle(1917-1918) was an artist fore an Indianapolis newspaper. Quite by accident, discovered a rag doll in a barrel in his mother's attic. His mother played with the doll when she was a little girl. She loved the heart with 'I Love You' that is embroidered on every doll. John began writing books about the doll and soon became very wealthy. He died in 1938. Books and dolls still sold. Trademark registered in 1915 John B. Gruelle. Doll is hand and machine-made. Dress is machine-made.""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
